block.p: The Christian Science board of directors will establish a $50 million research library and exhibit space in Boston to house a vast collection of papers related to Mary Baker Eddy, the faith's founder and one of the most influential women in American religious history.

The Christian Science board of directors will establish a $50 million research library and exhibit space in Boston to house a vast collection of papers related to Mary Baker Eddy, the faith's founder and one of the most influential women in American religious history.

The project, to be called the Mary Baker Eddy Library for the Betterment of Humanity, is scheduled to open in June 2002 at the church center in the Back Bay neighborhood, said the board's chairwoman, Virginia S. Harris. It will house about 500,000 papers either by or related to Mrs. Eddy.
